course_title: Topics in Afr American Studies: Black Middle Class in Film

Closed to 1st year Students 
Course Description: 
Title:  The Black Middle Class in Film & Photography
This course examines how the black middle class is represented in visual culture. From the Dubois Paris Exposition to "Blackish" , we see how classism and racism collide in film and photography.
course_description: This course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, social and literary texts, and the social sciences.
sections: Class Nbr: 1889, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 1-2:15p, Instructor: K. Wallace-Sanders, Status: Open
